metadata.title: ShelfCare - All wardrobe repair and maintenance services
metadata.description: ShelfCare makes tailoring, cobbler and laundry services more accessible and appealing. We integrate these services into consumers’ wardrobe care routines, promoting sustainable fashion and personal style. Embrace quality over quantity with ShelfCare, where your beloved clothes and unique style are the focus.
metadata.keywords: ShelfCare, sustainable fashion, wardrobe care, clothing repair, shoe maintenance, accessory repair, personal style, quality over quantity, fashion sustainability, tailor, cobbler, shoe repair, laundry, dry cleaning

hero.title: High quality tailoring, cobbler and laundry services in Helsinki metropolitan area
hero.subtitle: Place an order and we will pick up your items for some ShelfCare.

how_it_works.title: How the service works
how_it_works.subtitle: Get started with these easy steps:

step1.title: Place an order
step1.description: Send us a message with your repair and maintenance needs and we will make a service plan for you.

step2.title: Choose a pickup time
step2.description: We will come and get your items at your chosen pickup time.

step3.title: Enjoy your ShelfCared items
step3.description: We deliver the items back to you at your chosen return time.

mission-vision.title: Our mission & vision
mission-vision.mission: Our mission is to make wardrobe repair and maintenance services accessible and appealing, and establish these services as a regular activity for wardrobe care and sustainable fashion consumption.
mission-vision.vision: ShelfCare stands for the new age of fashion industry where quality cancels out quantity. Instead of following trends and continuous consumption, focus is on personal style, perfectly fitting and beloved clothes that their owners want to take good care of.

tailoring.title: Tailoring
tailoring.description: Get your clothes repaired and altered to perfection. You’ll get more wear out of your clothes when they feel comfortable and fit well.

laundry.title: Laundry
laundry.description: Get your clothes professionally cleaned with special care given to delicate fabrics. We keep your clothes fresh and well-maintained and they continue to look great over time.

cobbler.title: Cobbler
cobbler.description: Get your shoes, bags and leather goods repaired and maintained. With cobbler services you can extend the lifespan of your items.

order-start.title: Want to fix an item?
order-start.subtitle: Start by selecting the type of item (clothing, shoes, leather goods) you want to fix.
order-start.error: Please select an item type to continue.

team.title: Here's ShelfCare team
team.description: Our values are simple, we believe in circularity, self-expression and confidence.

contact.title: Get in touch
contact.successMessage: Your message has been sent successfully!
contact.errorMessage: There was an error sending the message, please try again later.

general.heading: 1. General
general.content: These terms of service apply to the tailoring, cobbler, and laundry services provided by ShelfCare Ltd ('we', 'our', or 'the company'). By ordering our services, you ('you' or 'the customer') agree to comply with these terms.

ordering.heading: 2. Ordering services
ordering.content: Ordering services takes place through our website. The customer is responsible for ensuring that the information provided, such as measurements and other specifications, is correct and accurate. We reserve the right to reject the order if the information is incomplete or incorrect.

pricing.heading: 3. Pricing and payment terms
pricing.content: Service prices are visible on our website. By ordering, the customer agrees to pay for the services according to the price list. If the scope of work exceeds the definition of the ordered service, we will agree separately with the customer on the service and price. Once items are taken to the service provider, the customer will receive a payment request on the ordering portal or an invoice in their email. Invoices have seven day payment term. We reserve the right to make changes to the price list. The changes wll not affect already made and confirmed orders.

transport.heading: 4. Logistics
transport.content: We offer a pickup and return service to the address provided by the customer. We charge a €10 logistics and service fee at the time of order. Pickup and return times are agreed upon with the customer. We reserve the right to charge an additional fee due to customer's failure to be present at pickup or return. The order is confirmed once the customer selects a pickup time for the order.

handling.heading: 5. Product handling and quality
handling.content: We commit to handling the customer's products properly and professionally. If the customer is not satisfied with the quality of the service, they must notify us in writing within 7 days of the return of the products. We strive to correct any deficiencies or errors at no additional cost to the customer if the error is due to us. Please note that our services are based on the information you provide. If you are not satisfied with the outcome and the service has been carried out according to the infromation you have provided, we can agree separately on additional corrections and the cost of such corrections.

liability.heading: 6. Limitation of liability
liability.content: We are not responsible for any damage to products that result from incorrect measurements or information provided and/or accepted by the customer. We are not responsible for any delays or issues arising from factors that are beyond our control, such as weather conditions, traffic disruptions or other similar reasons. Our liability is always limited to the price of the service. We want to ensure that you are satisfied with the service you receive, and we will make every effort within reason to resolve the situation so that you are pleased with the final outcome.

cancellation.heading: 7. Cancellation policy
cancellation.content: The customer may cancel the order free of charge before the products are picked up. If cancellation is made after pickup but before the work has started, the customer is liable to pay for the transportation costs. If services are already started, the customer is liable to pay for the services performed until cancellation notice.

privacy.heading: 8. Privacy and data protection
privacy.content: We are committed to protecting the personal data of customers and processing it in accordance with data protection legislation.

other.heading: 9. Other terms
other.content: We reserve the right to change these terms without notice. Changes will take effect when published on our website.

contact.heading: 10. Contact information
contact.content: If you have any questions about these terms, you can contact us by email at maija.tunturi@shelfcare.app.

section4.heading: 4. Purpose and legal basis for processing personal data
section4.content: The purpose of processing personal data includes:
section4.instruction-1: The legal basis for processing personal data includes:
- Legal obligations of the data controller
- Legitimate interests of the data controller

section5.heading: 5. Content of the register
section5.content: The register may contain the following information:
section5.instruction-1: - Information related to the customer relationship (e.g., order history, customer feedback)

section6.heading: 6. Regular data sources
section6.instruction-1: - Directly from the customer during the customer relationship
- When the customer uses services provided by ShelfCare Oy

section7.heading: 7. Regular data disclosures
section7.content: Personal data may be disclosed to:
section7.instruction-1: - Our service providers and partners who process data on our behalf
- Authorities in cases required by law

section8.heading: 8. Transfer of data outside the EU or EEA
section8.content: Personal data is generally not transferred outside the EU/EEA. If a transfer is necessary, we ensure that it occurs legally and with adequate safeguards.

section9.heading: 9. Rights of the data subject
section9.content: The data subject has the following rights:
section9.instruction-1: - Right to access their personal data
- Right to object to data processing
- Right to withdraw consent at any time
Data subjects can exercise their rights by contacting our Data Protection Officer. All requests must be submitted in writing to the contact person mentioned above.

section10.heading: 10. Changes to the privacy policy
section10.content: ShelfCare Oy reserves the right to change this privacy policy. Any substantial changes to our privacy policy will be announced on the ShelfCare Oy website and/or to customers via email.

pricing.title: Price list
pricing.disclaimer: Here you can find the list of our services and prices. If you can't find the service you are looking for, send us a message - we will find a solution!

instructions.instruction-1: Fold the fabric at the thigh area. Adjust the length by folding the fabric until you find the desired length for the leg. Measure the amount to be shortened from the fold. Keep in mind that the fabric is two-folded, so you need to double the measurement taken on one side.
instructions.instruction-2: Folding the fabric at the thigh area helps you to determine the right leg length. Shortening will be done at the leg opening.
instructions.instruction-3: You can also mark the shortening with a safety pin. Mark the shortening in the same way by folding the fabric.

instructions.instruction-1: Fold the fabric at the leg. Measure the amount to be narrowed. Remember, the fabric is two-folded, so you need to double the measurement taken on one side. Measure the distance from the bottom of the leg to the point where you want the narrowing to begin.
instructions.instruction-2: You can also mark the narrowing with a safety pin. Mark the narrowing at the leg opening and the spot where you want the narrowing to start.
instructions.instruction-3: Example: You want the narrowing to start 30cm up from the bottom of the leg, with a 6cm narrowing at the leg opening.

section-3.heading: Waist narrowing for trousers, jeans and skirts

instructions.instruction-1: Fold the fabric at the waist. Measure the amount to be narrowed. Keep in mind that the fabric is two-folded, so you need to double the measurement taken on one side. Measure the distance from the waistline to the point where you want the narrowing to begin.
instructions.instruction-2: You can also mark the narrowing with a safety pin. Mark the narrowing at waist and the spot where you want the narrowing to start.
instructions.instruction-3: Example: You want to start narrowing 10cm down from the waistline, with a 4cm narrowing at the waistline.

instructions.instruction-1: Measure the amount of widening needed at the waist. Measure the point down from the waistline where you want the widening to start.
instructions.instruction-2: Example: You want the widening to start 10cm down from the waistline, with a 4cm widening at the waistline.
instructions.instruction-3: Make sure the inner back seam has enough extra fabric for the widening.

instructions.instruction-1: Fold the fabric at the elbow area. Adjust the length by folding the fabric until you find the desired length for the sleeve. Measure the amount to be shortened from the fold. Keep in mind that the fabric is two-folded, so you need to double the measurement taken on one side.
instructions.instruction-2: Folding the fabric at the elbow area helps you to determine the right leg length. Shortening will be done at the sleeve opening.
instructions.instruction-3: You can also mark the shortening with a safety pin. Mark the shortening in the same way by folding the fabric.

section-6.heading: Waist narrowing for skirts, blazers, jackets and dresses

instructions.instruction-2: a) the distance from the hem to the point where you want the narrowing to start.
instructions.instruction-3: b) the distance from the hem to the point where you want the narrowing to be at its maximum.
instructions.instruction-4: c) how much you want to narrow the garment at its maximum.
instructions.instruction-5: d) the distance from the hem to the point where you want the narrowing to end, or if you want the narrowing to continue to the hem, measure how much narrowing you want at the hem.
instructions.instruction-6: You can also mark the points with safety pins as an alternative.
instructions.instruction-7: Narrowing is done following the original shape and cut.
instructions.instruction-8: Example: You want to start narrowing at a point 30cm up from the hem and end narrowing at a point 10cm up from the hem. The maximum narrowing need is 4cm, and the 4cm narrowing is wanted at a point 17cm up from the hem. The shirt will be narrowed between the starting and ending points, with a maximum narrowing of 4cm at 17cm up from the hem.

section-7.heading: Hem shortening for shirts, blazers and jackets

instructions.instruction-1: Measure the amount of shortening needed at the hem.
instructions.instruction-2: The shortening will be done according to the original cut at the hem. Alternatively, you can mark the shortening with safety pins.

section-8.heading: Hem shortening for skirts, dresses and long coats and jackets

instructions.instruction-1: Fold the fabric at the thigh area. Adjust the length by folding the fabric until you find the desired length. Measure the amount to be shortened from the fold. Keep in mind that the fabric is two-folded, so you need to double the measurement taken on one side.
instructions.instruction-2: Folding the fabric at the thigh area helps you to determine the right hem length. Shortening will be done at the hem.
instructions.instruction-3: You can also mark the shortening with a safety pin. Mark the shortening in the same way by folding the fabric.

instructions.instruction-1: Fold the strap. Measure the amount to be shortened. Keep in mind that the fabric is two-fold,  so you need to double the measurement taken on one side.
Measure how much lengthening is needed. Make sure the sleeve has enough fabric for lengthening.

Fold the fabric in half at the sleeve opening. Measure the amount to be narrowed. Keep in mind that the fabric is two-folded, so you need to double the measurement taken on one side. Measure the distance from the sleeve opening to the point where you want the narrowing to begin.
instructions.instruction-2: You can also mark the narrowing with a safety pin. Mark the narrowing at sleeve opening and the spot where you want the narrowing to start.
instructions.instruction-3: Example: You want the narrowing to start 30cm up from the sleeve opening, with a 4cm narrowing at the sleeve opening.

instructions.instruction-1: Fold the fabric above the shoulder. Adjust the folding until you find the desired width for the shoulder. Measure the amount to be narrowed from the fold. Keep in mind that the fabric is two-folded, so you need to double the measurement taken on one side. Folding the fabric above the shoulder helps you to determine the right shoulder width. Narrowing is done at the seam between shoulder and sleeve.
instructions.instruction-2: You can also mark the narrowing with a safety pin. Mark the narrowing in the same way by folding the fabric.

order-details.title: Order Details
order-details.additionalNotesPlaceholder: Add any specific instructions or notes for your adjustments...
order-details.uploadImagesSubtitle: Please upload images showing the specific areas that need adjustments.
order-details.dragAndDropFiles: Drag & drop files here, or click to select files

order.title: Place Your Order
order.subtitle: Choose pickup and return time, fill in order information and your contact information. You don't have to pack the items - we bring the bags for it.
order.subtitle-2: Check out the price list <link1>here</link1> and the measurement guide <link2>here</link2>. €10 service and logistics fee is added to all orders. You will receive an invoice via email after pickup.
order.pickupDateLabel: When do we pick up the goods?
order.returnDateLabel: When do we return the items back to you?
order.returnPickupDateDescription: Services are performed within 7 days - the first option for return date is a week after the pickup.
order.orderImageInstruction: Upload images showing the specific areas that need adjustments.
order.orderDetailsInstruction1: In the order details, fill in the items you are sending and what services you want. State measurement information if needed. Let us know if you want us take your measurements during pickup.
order.orderDetailsInstruction2: You can also leave questions about the order and the packages here, and the order will be confirmed later.
order.orderDetailsPlaceholder: Order details e.g., 'Silk shirt, shorten sleeve by 2cm...'
order.successMessage: Your order has been submitted successfully!
order.error: There was an error. Please try again later.

user-dashboard.profile-subtitle: Here you can edit your account information.
user-dashboard.order-subtitle: Check the status of recent orders and manage pickup and delivery time slots.
user-dashboard.welcome-message:
Welcome to do some ShelfCare!

Send us pictures of the items you want to be fixed or maintained. We will ask all necessary questions and give you a service plan including prices. Then you will be provided with pickup options.

We are here also to answer any questions, so let's chat!​

Please, note that we are operating in Helsinki metropolitan area at the moment.
user-dashboard.order-confirmation:
You have chosen pickup time: **{pickupOption}** ja palautussajan: **{deliveryOption}**. Make sure you have filled out your account info so that we have your address. See you then! 

If you need to change pickup or return time, you can go to your orders and edit the pickup and return times 24 hours before. 

If you want to add items to your order, you can do so by sending us a message with pictures. :)
user-dashboard.first-message-auto-reply: Thank you messaging us! We'll get back to you as soon as possible.
